input_text:
Job Title: Lead Inventory Team Member

Location: Charlotte, NC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
As an Inventory Control Lead, you will assist in maintaining a high level of inventory by resolving inventory variances and

discrepancies for incoming as well as existing products that arise during the day-to-day operations at the Chick-fil-A Supply Distribution Center in Charlotte (Kannapolis), NC. We are looking for a highly organized team player with exceptional attention to detail and exceptional focus to join our growing team!

About Chick-fil-A Supply

Chick-fil-A Supply, LLC, a wholly owned subsidiary of Chick-fil-A, Inc., is an innovative distribution service provider focused on understanding and meeting the unique needs of Chick-fil-AÂ® restaurants. Chick-fil-A Supply ensures restaurants have the food and products they need through a seamless delivery experience that extends the Chick-fil-A culture of care. For more information, visit cfa-supply.com.

Responsibilities


 Timely submission and tracking of damage claims to supplier and/or distribution partners Verify and maintain records on inventory adjustments, movements and transfers, request backup documentation,


and resolve discrepancies


 Assist in inventory related projects, such as: disposals, donations, relocation of inventory, and


consolidation/organization


 Perform assorted administrative duties, such as: document management, reporting, filing, and scheduling Provide timely feedback to inventory related emails and correspondence Ensure inventory accuracy through the completion of effective control techniques including internal audits, cycle and


audit counts.


 Identify, quarantine, and report damaged or supplier recalled/withdrawn product to assure it is accurately captured


and removed from inventory


 Ensure pick availability by responding to and finding a solution for any issue with a location error, product attributes,


or location attributes.


 Ensure the appropriate handling, removal, disposal, and processing of damaged or expired product Maintain warehouse slot integrity and responsible for slotting new or seasonal items. Assist in the development of localized policies and procedures as related to the control of inventory Assist with root cause analysis and offer solutions related to inventory inaccuracies Work with team members to reinforce the importance of inventory accuracy


Minimum Qualifications


 Education: High School or equivalent 2 years of warehouse experience


Required Business Qualifications:


 Logical and analytical skills Intermediate proficiency of computer skills; working knowledge of MS Word, Excel, Outlook Familiarity and comfort with navigating and executing in the WMS system Proven record of working independently with little oversight Exceptional attention to detail and highly organized High degree of initiative and urgency Self-Starter and comfortable with ambiguity Proactive problem solver that is solutions oriented Work in extreme temperature conditions for extended periods of time (0 degrees Fahrenheit) Complete physically demanding work, including frequently lifting up to 50 pounds and occasionally moving with mechanical assistance up to 2,000 pounds Reach, bend, and stoop while performing work Work while standing for several hours at a time Prepare for a flexible schedule including weekends and holidays


Preferred Qualifications


 3+ years of warehouse experience Experience in inventory control, claims management, or similar job function is a plus Material handling equipment proficiency


Minimum Years Of Experience

2

Travel Requirements

10%

Required Level Of Education

High School

Preferred Level Of Education

Associates Degree

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
